Limit cipher suites and set MinProtocol = TLSv1.2
Set smtpd_tls_security_level = encrypt; disable SSLv2/3
Bind SSL to TLSv1.2+ and strong ciphers
Recommendations.HSTS: Add http-response set-header Strict-Transport-Security max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains

Recommendations.TLS: Limit cipher suites and set MinProtocol = TLSv1.2
Set smtpd_tls_security_level = encrypt; disable SSLv2/3
Bind SSL to TLSv1.2+ and strong ciphers
Recommendations.HSTS: Add http-response set-header Strict-Transport-Security max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains

Recommendations.TLS: Use tls: with minimum TLS 1.2 and valid certs under ingress.spec.
Avoid storing hardcoded keys and secrets without encryption.

Protocols.remediation_reason: This setting is insecure or outdated based on modern security standards.
This setting is insecure or outdated based on modern security standards.

Protocols.reason: TLS 1.3 is the most secure and modern protocol. Source: IETF RFC 8446
TLS 1.2 is widely supported and secure when configured properly. Source: NIST SP 800-52r2
SSL 2.0 is deprecated due to multiple vulnerabilities including POODLE. Source: NIST SP 800-52r2
SSL 3.0 is deprecated due to POODLE vulnerability. Source: NIST SP 800-52r2
TLS 1.0 is considered insecure. Deprecated by PCI-DSS v3.2.1 and major browsers. Source: Microsoft TLS deprecation notice
TLS 1.1 is deprecated due to weak cryptographic design. Source: IETF RFC 8996

CipherSuites.reason: Strong AEAD cipher for TLS 1.3. Recommended in RFC 8446.
Efficient AEAD cipher for TLS 1.3. Recommended in RFC 8446.
AEAD cipher for TLS 1.3, optimized for software implementations. Recommended in RFC 8446.
Secure and provides forward secrecy. Recommended in RFC 7525.
Strong encryption and forward secrecy. Recommended in RFC 7525.
Balanced performance and security with forward secrecy. Mozilla SSL config recommendation.
Provides forward secrecy and strong encryption. Mozilla SSL config recommendation.
Does not provide forward secrecy and is vulnerable to BEAST and Lucky13. Deprecated in RFC 7525.
Lacks forward secrecy and is vulnerable to known attacks. Deprecated in RFC 7525.
Weak encryption and vulnerable to SWEET32. Deprecated in RFC 7525.
RC4 is insecure and prohibited. Deprecated in RFC 7465.
NULL cipher provides no encryption. Should never be used. OWASP TLS Guidelines.
